column4: i got win7 on my new pc but i want to put ubuntu to dual boot onto it but the problem is i only have 32bit 9.04 linux and i want 64bit 9.10 linux
i only have the disc for a 9/04 32bit
can i upgrade onto a 64bit from a 32bit
i want my new pc to use all my 4gb ram and my 512mb
wil linux be compatible with 4gb ram
but i want linux to use 4.ghz processor and all of my ram which win 7 is doing atm
will it do it?!? on a 32bit?
on 32bit and EXACTLY 4 gb of ram . part of it will not be addressable
because they dont want to bother? they woud rather sell you  stuff they make a profit on.
to to the local book stores and they are in all sorts of computer magazines. Or often public libraries have them
linux is not windows.. Im not even sure there are any comercial AV programs out for linux. ( i imagine ther are some but they are for scanning windows files)
if you want one. theres clamav, and avg has a linux version i recall.
but they are designed to scan your windows systems/files for infections - not linux normally
